Package algorithms

Class QuickSort

java.lang.Object
algorithms.QuickSort
public class QuickSort extends Object
A util class for sorting a Comparable array using Quicksort algorithm. This algorithm divides the problem into smaller problems until each small problem is too small to divide further. It does this by partitioning subarrays to move the pivot element to the right position. All elements to the left of the pivot should be greater than the elements to the right of the pivot. Then repeating the partitioning on the subarrays to the left and right side of the pivot element.
Author:
Debora Kwon

    quicksort(T[] arr, int low, int high)
    Runs Quicksort sort algorithm in-place on a subarray of arr If the size of the subarray is greater than 1, then partition the subarray and recursively call quicksort on the left and right sides of the partition.

    • quicksort

      public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> void quicksort(T[] arr, int low, int high)
      Runs Quicksort sort algorithm in-place on a subarray of arr If the size of the subarray is greater than 1, then partition the subarray and recursively call quicksort on the left and right sides of the partition.
      Parameters:
      arr - A collection of Comparables
      low - the start of the subarray
      high - the end of the subarray

      Parameters:
      arr - A collection of Comparables
      low - the start of the subarray
      high - the end of the subarray
      Returns:
